data.title: Adam Schlesinger - Trivia, Family, Bio
data.meta_description: Adam Schlesinger: his birthday, what he did before fame, his family life, fun trivia facts, popularity rankings, and more.
data.text:
About

Best known as the bassist for the power pop group Fountains of Wayne, this popular musician also had a career as a songwriter, composing the score for a 2008 Broadway musical called Cry-Baby. For his performing and songwriting work, he earned Grammy, Tony, Emmy, and Academy Award nominations.

Before Fame

Early in his career, he was nominated, along with his Fountains of Wayne bandmates, for two Grammys for the popular song "Stacy's Mom."

Trivia

He and his frequent music writing partner, David Javerbaum, composed several show-stopping numbers that were performed by Neil Patrick Harris at the 2011 and 2012 Tony Awards ceremonies.

Family Life

He was born and raised in New York City and Montclair, New Jersey. His grandfather, Murray Bernthal, had a successful career as a music producer.

Associated With
